template.name: ZYXEL IES1248-51 by SNMP
template.description:
ZYXEL IES1248-51
MIBs used: RFC1213-MIB HOST-RESOURCES-MIB ADSL-LINE-MIB ZYXEL-IESCOMMON-MIB IF-MIB
Known Issues:
Description: Incorrect handling of SNMP bulk requests. Disable the use of bulk requests in the SNMP interface settings. Version: all versions firmware Device: ZYXEL IES1248-51
You can discuss this template or leave feedback on our forum https://www.zabbix.com/forum/zabbix-suggestions-and-feedback/422668-discussion-thread-for-official-zabbix-templates-for-zyxel
Template tooling version used: 0.41

trigger.name: ZYXEL IES1248-51: No SNMP data collection
trigger.description: SNMP is not available for polling. Please check device connectivity and SNMP settings.

item.name: ZYXEL IES1248-51: Contact
item.description: MIB: RFC1213-MIB The textual identification of the contact person for this managed node, together with information on how to contact this person.

trigger.expression: last(/ZYXEL IES1248-51 by SNMP/zyxel.ies1248.fwversion,#1)<>last(/ZYXEL IES1248-51 by SNMP/zyxel.ies1248.fwversion,#2) and length(last(/ZYXEL IES1248-51 by SNMP/zyxel.ies1248.fwversion))>0
trigger.name: ZYXEL IES1248-51: Firmware has changed
trigger.description: Firmware version has changed. Ack to close

item.name: ZYXEL IES1248-51: Uptime (hardware)
item.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The amount of time since this host was last initialized. Note that this is different from sysUpTime in the SNMPv2-MIB [RFC1907] because sysUpTime is the uptime of the network management portion of the system.

item.name: ZYXEL IES1248-51: Location
item.description: MIB: RFC1213-MIB The physical location of this node (e.g., `telephone closet, 3rd floor').

item.name: ZYXEL IES1248-51: MAC address
item.description: MIB: IF-MIB The interface's address at the protocol layer immediately `below' the network layer in the protocol stack. For interfaces which do not have such an address (e.g., a serial line), this object should contain an octet string of zero length.

item.name: ZYXEL IES1248-51: Hardware model name
item.description: MIB: RFC1213-MIB A textual description of the entity. This value should include the full name and version identification of the system's hardware type, software operating-system, and networking software. It is mandatory that this only contain printable ASCII characters.

trigger.name: ZYXEL IES1248-51: Template does not match hardware
trigger.description: This template is for Zyxel IES1248-51, but connected to {ITEM.VALUE}

item.name: ZYXEL IES1248-51: Host name
item.description: MIB: RFC1213-MIB An administratively-assigned name for this managed node. By convention, this is the node's fully-qualified domain name.

item.name: ZYXEL IES1248-51: Uptime (network)
item.description: MIB: RFC1213-MIB The time (in hundredths of a second) since the network management portion of the system was last re-initialized.

trigger.expression: last(/ZYXEL IES1248-51 by SNMP/zyxel.ies1248.serialnumber,#1)<>last(/ZYXEL IES1248-51 by SNMP/zyxel.ies1248.serialnumber,#2) and length(last(/ZYXEL IES1248-51 by SNMP/zyxel.ies1248.serialnumber))>0
trigger.name: ZYXEL IES1248-51: Device has been replaced
trigger.event_name: ZYXEL IES1248-51: Device has been replaced (new serial number received)
trigger.description: Device serial number has changed. Ack to close

item.name: ZYXEL IES1248-51: Alarm status
item.description: MIB: ZYXEL-IESCOMMON-MIB This variable indicates the alarm status of the module. It is a bit map represented a sum, therefore, it can represent multiple defects simultaneously. The moduleNoDefect should be set if and only if no other flag is set. The various bit positions are: 1 moduleNoDefect 2 moduleOverHeat 3 moduleFanRpmLow 4 moduleVoltageLow 5 moduleThermalSensorFailure 6 modulePullOut 7 powerDC48VAFailure 8 powerDC48VBFailure 9 extAlarmInputTrigger 10 moduleDown 11 mscSwitchOverOK 12 networkTopologyChange 13 macSpoof 14 cpuHigh 15 memoryUsageHigh 16 packetBufferUsageHigh 17 loopguardOccurence

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES1248-51: Fan #{#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: MIB: ZYXEL-IESCOMMON-MIB Current speed in Revolutions Per Minute (RPM) on the fan.

trigger_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES1248-51: FAN{#SNMPINDEX} is in critical state

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES1248-51: Port {#SNMPINDEX}: Administrative status
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The desired state of the interface. The testing(3) state indicates that no operational packets can be passed.

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES1248-51: Port {#SNMPINDEX}: ATUC attenuation
item_prototype.description: MIB: ADSL-LINE-MIB Measured difference in the total power transmitted by the peer ATU and the total power received by this ATU. The Info Atuc fields show data acquired from the ATUC (ADSL Termination Unit – Central), in this case ZYXEL IES1248-51, during negotiation/provisioning message interchanges.

trigger_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES1248-51: High the DSL line attenuation in Port {#SNMPINDEX}
trigger_prototype.event_name: ZYXEL IES1248-51: High the DSL line attenuation in Port {#SNMPINDEX} (>{$ZYXEL.ADSL.ATN.MAX}dB for 5m)
trigger_prototype.description: The reductions in amplitude of the downstream and upstream DSL signals.

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES1248-51: Port {#SNMPINDEX}: ATUC output power
item_prototype.description: MIB: ADSL-LINE-MIB Measured total output power transmitted by this ATU. The Info Atuc fields show data acquired from the ATUC (ADSL Termination Unit – Central), in this case ZYXEL IES1248-51, during negotiation/provisioning message interchanges.

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES1248-51: Port {#SNMPINDEX}: ATUC noise margin
item_prototype.description: MIB: ADSL-LINE-MIB Noise Margin as seen by this ATU with respect to its received signal in tenth dB. The Info Atuc fields show data acquired from the ATUC (ADSL Termination Unit – Central), in this case ZYXEL IES1248-51, during negotiation/provisioning message interchanges.

trigger_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES1248-51: Low the DSL line noise margins in Port {#SNMPINDEX}
trigger_prototype.event_name: ZYXEL IES1248-51: Low the DSL line noise margins in Port {#SNMPINDEX} (<{$ZYXEL.ADSL.SNR.MIN}dB for 5m)
trigger_prototype.description: Signal-to-noise margin (SNR Margin) which is the difference between the actual SNR and the SNR required to sync at a specific speed

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES1248-51: Port {#SNMPINDEX}: ATUR attenuation
item_prototype.description: MIB: ADSL-LINE-MIB Measured difference in the total power transmitted by the peer ATU and the total power received by this ATU. The Info Atur fields show data acquired from the ATUR (ADSL Termination Unit – Remote), in this case the subscriber's ADSL modem or router, during negotiation/provisioning message interchanges.

trigger_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES1248-51: High the DSL line attenuation in Port {#SNMPINDEX}
trigger_prototype.event_name: ZYXEL IES1248-51: High the DSL line attenuation in Port {#SNMPINDEX} (>{$ZYXEL.ADSL.ATN.MAX}dB for 5m)
trigger_prototype.description: The reductions in amplitude of the downstream and upstream DSL signals.

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES1248-51: Port {#SNMPINDEX}: ATUR output power
item_prototype.description: MIB: ADSL-LINE-MIB Measured total output power transmitted by this ATU. The Info Atur fields show data acquired from the ATUR (ADSL Termination Unit – Remote), in this case the subscriber's ADSL modem or router, during negotiation/provisioning message interchanges.

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES1248-51: Port {#SNMPINDEX}: ATUR noise margin
item_prototype.description: MIB: ADSL-LINE-MIB Noise Margin as seen by this ATU with respect to its received signal in tenth dB. The Info Atur fields show data acquired from the ATUR (ADSL Termination Unit – Remote), in this case the subscriber's ADSL modem or router, during negotiation/provisioning message interchanges.

trigger_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES1248-51: Low the DSL line noise margins in Port {#SNMPINDEX}
trigger_prototype.event_name: ZYXEL IES1248-51: Low the DSL line noise margins in Port {#SNMPINDEX} (<{$ZYXEL.ADSL.SNR.MIN}dB for 5m)
trigger_prototype.description: Signal-to-noise margin (SNR Margin) which is the difference between the actual SNR and the SNR required to sync at a specific speed

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES1248-51: Port {#SNMPINDEX}: Incoming traffic
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The total number of octets received on the interface, including framing characters.

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES1248-51: Port {#SNMPINDEX}: Interface name
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB A textual string containing information about the interface

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES1248-51: Port {#SNMPINDEX}: Operational status
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The current operational state of the interface. The testing(3) state indicates that no operational packets can be passed.

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/ZYXEL IES1248-51 by SNMP/zyxel.ies1248.net.adsl.operstatus[{#SNMPINDEX}])=2 and last(/ZYXEL IES1248-51 by SNMP/zyxel.ies1248.net.adsl.operstatus[{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/ZYXEL IES1248-51 by SNMP/zyxel.ies1248.net.adsl.operstatus[{#SNMPINDEX}],#2)
trigger_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES1248-51: Port {#SNMPINDEX}: Link down
trigger_prototype.description:
This trigger expression works as follows: 1. Can be triggered if operations status is down. 2. {TEMPLATE_NAME:METRIC.diff()}=1) - trigger fires only if operational status was up(1) sometime before. (So, do not fire 'ethernal off' interfaces.)
WARNING: if closed manually - won't fire again on next poll, because of .diff.

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES1248-51: Port {#SNMPINDEX}: Outgoing traffic
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The total number of octets transmitted out of the interface, including framing characters. This object is a 64-bit version of ifOutOctets.

override.name: Don't create triggers for matching interface

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES1248-51: Port {#ZYXEL.IF.NAME}: Administrative status
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The desired state of the interface. The testing(3) state indicates that no operational packets can be passed.

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES1248-51: Port {#ZYXEL.IF.NAME}: Incoming traffic
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The total number of octets received on the interface, including framing characters.

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES1248-51: Port {#SNMPINDEX}: Interface name
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB A textual string containing information about the interface

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES1248-51: Port {#ZYXEL.IF.NAME}: Operational status
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The current operational state of the interface. The testing(3) state indicates that no operational packets can be passed.

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/ZYXEL IES1248-51 by SNMP/zyxel.ies1248.net.if.operstatus[{#SNMPINDEX}])=2 and last(/ZYXEL IES1248-51 by SNMP/zyxel.ies1248.net.if.operstatus[{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/ZYXEL IES1248-51 by SNMP/zyxel.ies1248.net.if.operstatus[{#SNMPINDEX}],#2)
trigger_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES1248-51: Port {#ZYXEL.IF.NAME}: Link down
trigger_prototype.description:
This trigger expression works as follows: 1. Can be triggered if operations status is down. 2. {TEMPLATE_NAME:METRIC.diff()}=1) - trigger fires only if operational status was up(1) sometime before. (So, do not fire 'ethernal off' interfaces.)
WARNING: if closed manually - won't fire again on next poll, because of .diff.

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES1248-51: Port {#ZYXEL.IF.NAME}: Outgoing traffic
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The total number of octets transmitted out of the interface, including framing characters. This object is a 64-bit version of ifOutOctets.

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES1248-51: Temperature "{#ZYXEL.TEMP.ID}"
item_prototype.description: MIB: ZYXEL-IESCOMMON-MIB The current temperature measured at this sensor

trigger_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES1248-51: Temperature {#ZYXEL.TEMP.ID} is in critical state

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES1248-51: Nominal "{#ZYXEL.VOLT.NOMINAL}"
item_prototype.description: MIB: ZYXEL-IESCOMMON-MIB The current voltage reading.

trigger_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES1248-51: Voltage {#ZYXEL.VOLT.NOMINAL} is in critical state

macro.description: The time interval for SNMP agent availability trigger expression.
Type the minimum signal to noise margin (0-31 dB)
Triggers will be created only for interfaces whose description contains the value of this macro
Filter to exclude discovered by link types.

trigger.expression: (last(/ZYXEL IES1248-51 by SNMP/zyxel.ies1248.hw.uptime)>0 and last(/ZYXEL IES1248-51 by SNMP/zyxel.ies1248.hw.uptime)<10m) or (last(/ZYXEL IES1248-51 by SNMP/zyxel.ies1248.hw.uptime)=0 and last(/ZYXEL IES1248-51 by SNMP/zyxel.ies1248.net.uptime)<10m)
trigger.name: ZYXEL IES1248-51: Host has been restarted
